content.description: Best bit of dirt burgling in the park.  Start under roof matched on monster undercling jug, paste feet and fire for holds at lip. Avoid the dab and mantle out.
content.location: From Pavillion parking area, turn right off red trail onto white.  Boulder is ~1 minute down trail, facing away as you approach.

content.description:
Stand start on corner of pedestal, climbing straight up and topping out boulder above.

 A sit start adds a few moves and bumps the grade but reduces the quality.
content.location: Large boulder perched on a pedestal at the main overlook area.

content.description:
Look for old aid pin directly above sketchy landing.  Stand start on right side of block, traversing left on awkward holds and sloping feet to stand up and gain seam with pin.  Traverse right along horizontal crack and then up to the large triangular feature before topping out.

 Be warned, some of the "jugs" at and behind the lip feel slightly loose, and the top is often in need of leaf removal.
content.protection: 2-3 pads well arranged and a solid spotter
content.location: From overlook area, head downhill towards Rocks road.  Split off slightly left and drop down a small ledge, turn right.  Alternatively hike along main formation, turn left from Strawberry jam.  Climb faces downhill

content.description: This is the main area at Rocks State Park.  It contains several smaller areas, and the majority of the highest quality climbs.
